title: Motherlode Mine

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Motherlode Mine is a members-only Mining training area located in the Dwarven Mine, requiring a pickaxe. At least 30 Mining is needed to mine on the lower level, and at least 72 Mining for the upper level. These stats cannot be boosted.

content:
This article has a money making guide: Motherlode Mine.
Please add tips to the subpage, rather than the article below.
Motherlode Mine
Released24 April 2014 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors2
LocationDwarven Mine (Asgarnia)
InhabitantsHumans, Dwarves
TeleportsSkills necklace (Mining Guild)
Map
Advanced data
Typedungeon
Pick & Shovel
The music which plays when inside the mine

The Motherlode Mine is a members-only Mining training area located in the Dwarven Mine, requiring a pickaxe. At least 30 Mining is needed to mine on the lower level, and at least 72 Mining for the upper level. These stats cannot be boosted.

Contents

  • 1 Getting there
  • 2 Features
    • 2.1 Mining ore veins
    • 2.2 Cleaning
    • 2.3 Ore rates
      • 2.3.1 Deposits
    • 2.4 Fixing broken struts
    • 2.5 Rockfalls
    • 2.6 Shortcut
    • 2.7 Upper level
  • 3 Rewards
  • 4 Changes
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 References

Getting there[edit | edit source]

  • Access the Dwarven Mine via the house in north-eastern Falador, east of the Falador Party Room. Go down the stairs and then enter the cave to the south.
  • Travel with the Skills necklace (You do not need 60 mining) to the Mining Guild. Climb down the ladder and enter the cave to the east.

Features[edit | edit source]

Mining ore veins[edit | edit source]

Runite Minor and a miner mining an ore vein in the Motherlode Mine.

Ore veins can be mined for pay-dirt, yielding 60 Mining experience each. On the lower level, veins have a 33% chance of depleting each time an ore is mined,[1] giving an expected 3 pay-dirt per vein mined.

The veins also have a chance to give uncut gems. The amulet of glory's mining effect can be used to increase the chance of receiving a gem. When a gem is mined, no experience is given for the gem, just the pay-dirt. This means that for each gem mined, you will get 60 less experience per inventory, thus wearing this amulet is not recommended when mining for experience or golden nuggets. You can optionally trade 100 golden nuggets with Prospector Percy for a gem bag to negate this effect.

Clue geodes cannot be obtained in the Motherlode Mine.

With 72 Mining, players can pay Prospector Percy a one-time fee of 100 golden nuggets to be granted permission to the upper level of the mine, which is accessible via the ladder near the bank chest. The upper level contains 64 additional ore veins that are closer to one another compared to the lower level. The upper level veins disappear when a pay-dirt is mined after more than 20 seconds after the first is mined, rather than having a probability of becoming depleted per ore mined.[2]

Cleaning[edit | edit source]

To clean the pay-dirt, deposit it into the hopper attached to the water circuit. When deposited, the pay-dirt will flow towards the sack at the other end. The sack can be searched to collect various ores and golden nuggets.

If a player logs out, or leaves the mine, while they have ores waiting to be collected, they will be there when they return.

Receiving each type of ore has a mining level requirement equal to the requirement for mining that tier of rock. Higher tier ores will also provide higher amounts of bonus experience when the pay-dirt reaches the sack.

Ore Level
required 		Bonus
experience 		GE Price
Coal 30 0 162
Golden nugget 30 0 Untradable
Gold ore 40 15 300
Mithril ore 55 30 125
Adamantite ore 70 45 1,100
Runite ore 85 75 11,019

Bonus experience is awarded when the deposited pay-dirt reaches the sack, not when the pay-dirt is deposited into the hopper or when the ores are drawn from the sack.

Average experience per pay dirt is 61.5 with at least level 85 Mining with the entire Prospector kit equipped. Using the ores in Smithing averages 51.125 experience per ore. If all the ores are collected from 85 to 99 Mining at Motherlode Mine, it will average out to 6,344,981 Smithing experience.

Ore rates[edit | edit source]

The ore received from pay-dirt is based on the player's Mining level, with better ores becoming more common at higher levels.

Ores are determined when the pay-dirt is mined, not when cleaning.[3] Higher level ore can be obtained by using a mining boost such as a dwarven stout or the dragon pickaxe's special attack while mining. This might be important for Ironmen who would like a low effort way to obtain ores above their mining levels.

Strangely, due to the rounding behavior of the game engine there are some levels where the golden nugget yield is slightly higher.

Deposits[edit | edit source]

The HUD displaying the amount of pay-dirt in the sack.

The hopper does not allow pay-dirt to be be deposited into the hopper once the sack contains at least 81 items, or 162 if the sack upgrade has been purchased from Prospector Percy for 200 golden nuggets. The hopper also does not allow two stacks of pay-dirt from the same player in the waterway at once. Once the sack has a minimum of 81 (or 162) items, a chatbox message states: "Some ore is ready to be collected from the sack. It's getting full." At this point, the hopper will not accept deposits until the sack is searched and there are fewer than 81 (or 162) items in the sack.

The hopper will always accept an entire inventory of pay-dirt if there is no pay-dirt in the waterway from the player and the sack has not yet reached at least 81 (or 162) items. Thus, an "extra" 27 pay-dirt can be deposited into the hopper before it is cleaned by first totaling deposits to one less than the maximum (80, or 161 with the sack upgrade). Overall it is recommended to carry a hammer and a gem bag to maximise both profit and the number of deposits. Below are examples of optimal orders of deposits:

  • Regular sack: 24 + 28 + 28 + 28 = 108 pay-dirt, or 27 + 27 + 26 + 28 = 108 pay-dirt.
  • Upgraded sack: 21 + 28 + 28 + 28 + 28 + 28 + 28 = 189 pay-dirt, or 27 + 27 + 27 + 27 + 27 + 26 + 28= 189 pay-dirt.

The most consistent method to avoid wasting time dropping anything is to have your hammer and either your gem bag or stack of golden nuggets in your inventory, although this allows you to only pick up 26 items at a time. The gem bag will also negate the need to drop or bank gems. With this method, you can deposit up to 104 pay-dirt, or up to 182 with sack upgrade.

Fixing broken struts[edit | edit source]

A player using a hammer to fix a waterwheel.

Occasionally, the struts on the water wheels will break. This event is visible to everyone and is not player-specific. If both of them are broken, the water flow will stop, and any pay-dirt that was making its way to the sack will be frozen in place until the water flow is restored.

The struts can be fixed using a hammer and grants Smithing experience equal to 1.5 times the player's Smithing level. Hammers can be found in the crates surrounding the machine. You can also hop to another world where the strut is already intact, as the result will be the same.

The chance to repair a strut is dependent on Smithing level, with a base chance of 12% to repair each tick at level 1, up to a 27% chance each tick at level 99.[4]

Rockfalls[edit | edit source]

Rocks will occasionally fall in certain areas of the mine, blocking players' ways through the mine. They can be mined away for 10 experience. Runite Minor and the other miners may remove these rockfalls, though they tend to be busy mining for pay-dirt. Box traps and other traps placed on the ground may be laid to temporarily prevent rockfalls from blocking a path, until the box trap collapses.

Falling rocks will damage any unlucky players who happen to be standing under them for a few (1-4) Hitpoints.

Shortcut[edit | edit source]

There is a shortcut by the bank chest, connecting the east side of the mine to the centre. The shortcut requires 54 Agility and completion of the medium Falador Diary to use.

Upper level[edit | edit source]

At a cost of 100 golden nuggets, players with 72 Mining can unlock the upper level by trading with Prospector Percy. Unlocking this early on is strongly recommended, especially for players that lack the 54 Agility required for the shortcut. The upper level is closer to the bank and hopper, and the ore veins mechanics are time-based and shareable with others, in contrast to the veins at the lower levels that have a 33% chance of depleting whenever a pay-dirt is mined.

Due to the ore vein timer starting after the first ore is mined, mining veins on low population worlds that are not in use by other players will provide more consistent timings and will be more low effort.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Golden nuggets can be obtained by searching the sack after cleaning the pay-dirt, with 2.74% chance per pay-dirt, independent of Mining levels.[5] Each golden nugget in the sack is collected at once. Golden nuggets are used as currency at Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop to trade for a variety of rewards.

Sells at: 100.0% • Buys at: 80.0% • Change per: 0.0%

Prospector helmet1000.6s 40 320.4%0.010%/
Prospector jacket1000.6s 60 480.8%0.013%/

Soft clay pack10000.6s 10 8N/AN/A
Bag full of gems1000.6s 40 32N/AN/A

Note that bag full of gems and soft clay packs bought elsewhere cannot be resold here.

Furthermore, players can talk to Prospector Percy to gain access to the upper level (with 72 Mining) or upgrade the pay-dirt sack for respectively 100 and 200 golden nuggets.

The experience and profit rates of Motherlode Mine can vary based on level, the tier of pickaxe used, the amount of other players and whether the upper floor is used; it does not scale linearly. With rough estimates, players with 30 Mining can expect approximately 20,000 experience and 2,000 profit per hour, with 61 Mining approximately 30,000 experience and 20,000 profit per hour, and with 99 Mining approximately 52,000 experience and 300,000 profit per hour.

Compared to other methods of training Mining, Motherlode Mine requires relatively low effort for moderate experience and profit, and it is one of the least attention-requiring methods. In contrast, mining iron ore or granite can provide significantly higher experience rates, at the cost of being more click-intensive and offering no profit, as those items are dropped when mining efficiently.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
Date unknown

The Medium Falador Diary no longer provides any increased chance of receiving higher ores when cleaning pay dirt.[6]

31 October 2019
(update)

The clickzone of the top of the ladder in Motherlode Mine has been improved.

23 February 2017
(update | poll)
  • For the price of 200 Nuggets, you can now double the capacity of the pay-dirt sack in Motherlode Mine by speaking to Prospector Percy.
  • The HUD shown while in the Motherlode mine now displays how much Pay-dirt is in the Pay-dirt Sack.
  • The Ore veins found on the upper level of the Motherlode Mine now disappear a random period of time after they are first mined, rather than depleting faster if multiple people are mining them.
30 April 2015
(update)

Pets now follow you up and down the Motherlode Mine's ladder.

23 April 2015
(update)

The Motherlode Mine's ladder has had its click-zone changed to help players click the correct end of it.

9 April 2015
(update | poll)

An expansion of the Motherlode Mine with a brand new upstairs area can be accessed by players with over 72 mining that have paid Percy a one-time fee of 100 nuggets.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)
  • There is now a shortcut in the Motherlode Mine that you can use at level 54 agility if you have completed the Falador Medium Diary.
  • There is now a slightly increased chance at receiving higher ores when cleaning pay-dirt if you have completed the Falador Medium Diary and a further increased chance if you have completed the Falador Elite Diary.
1 May 2014
(update)

Dwarves no longer deplete pay-dirt veins and when a vein is depleted the "empty rock" sound will play to all the adjacent players. The rate at which ore respawns has also been increased slightly.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

Some falling rocks wearing party hats during Christmas.
  • The rockfalls share the same model as the pet rock when they fall from the ceiling. As a result, the falling rocks wear party hats during Christmas.
  • An interesting note about the upper level is that when a player climbs up the ladder, the player character does not actually move up a plane in the game, rather the terrain on the upper level is simply raised up from the ground on the plane the player character is standing on, so the player will be able to see other players and NPCs on both levels (just like the mechanics in Castle Wars).
  • There are several popular culture and community references within the Motherlode Mine:
    • On the western side of the mine, there is an NPC named Runite Minor, named after the designer of the Motherlode Mine and winner of the 2014 Player Designed Content.
    • In the middle of Prospector Percy's machine, there is a baby mole with the examine text "Mooooooooooooole", a reference to a scene from the film Austin Powers in Goldmember.
    • Prospector Percy's appearance and examine text are references to the character Stinky Pete from Toy Story 2.
    • The miner in the northeastern corner of the mine has examine text that reads "Secretly, he'd like to rescue princesses and eat mushrooms", a reference to the Mario video game franchise as the miners share a similar appearance to its titular character.
    • A miner in the southwestern corner reveals that "he became a miner after his agoraphobia stopped him doing Sailing", a reference to the supposed Sailing skill.
    • A miner along the east wall's examine text reads "He could have been a great ballet dancer if they'd let him try." This is a reference to the film Billy Elliot, about a father's expectations for his son to be a miner, and not to follow his dreams of being a dancer.
    • A miner on the eastern side has the examine text “professional miners don’t actually whistle while they work” which is a reference to Disney’s Snow White and the Seven Dwarves
  • The machine Prospector Percy built to wash the pay-dirt is a cheap knockoff of the machine used in the Lovakengj blast mine. According to the operators, the design is a secret, and those who try to copy it would "never get it quite right" and "their machine would break down all the time", referencing the fact that the struts on the water wheel often break.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Mod Ash. "Shift-Click Drop & QoL." 23-Feb-2017 11:09:04. (Archived from the original on 28 August 2021.) Old School Announcements Forums.
  2. ^ Mod Ash. "General QoL!." 09-Mar-2017 13:06:57. (Archived from the original on 28 August 2021.) Old School Announcements Forums.
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 8 June 2015. (Archived from the original on 1 December 2019.) Mod Ash: "When it is mined. It'd stay as runite even if your level drops before you clean it."
  4. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. date=5 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 5 April 2022.) Mod Ash: "Yes, it's based on Smithing. 12% at level 1, 27% at level 99 for each roll."
  5. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 8 June 2015. (Archived from the original on 29 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Sorry, I just rechecked. It's actually a flat rate of 2.74% at all levels for a paydirt to become a gold nugget."
  6. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 15 March 2020. (Archived from the original on 15 March 2020.) Mod Ash: "There's just one buff to pay-dirt, and it's for the elite diary only. This matches what the diary master says if asked."

rawContent:
{{HasMMG|Motherlode Mine}}
{{Infobox Location
|name = Motherlode Mine
|image = [[File:Motherlode Mine.png|300px]]
|release = [[24 April]] [[2014]]
|update = The Motherlode Mine!
|members = Yes
|floors = 2
|location = [[Dwarven Mine]] ([[Asgarnia]])
|race = [[Human]]s, [[Dwarf|Dwarves]]
|teleport = [[Skills necklace]] (Mining Guild)
|map = [[File:Dwarven Mine map.png|300px]]
|type = dungeon
}}
{{Listen 
|title = Pick & Shovel 
|desc = The music which plays when inside the mine 
|filename = Pick & Shovel.ogg }}
The '''Motherlode Mine''' is a [[members-only]] [[Mining]] training area located in the [[Dwarven Mine]], requiring a [[pickaxe]]. At least 30 Mining is needed to mine on the lower level, and at least 72 Mining for the upper level. These stats cannot be boosted.

==Getting there==
*Access the Dwarven Mine via the house in north-eastern [[Falador]], east of the [[Falador Party Room]]. Go down the stairs and then enter the cave to the south.
*Travel with the [[Skills necklace]] (You do '''not''' need 60 mining) to the [[Mining Guild]]. Climb down the ladder and enter the cave to the east.

==Features==
===Mining ore veins===
[[File:Motherlode Mine - Mining ore veins.png|thumb|[[Runite Minor]] and a [[Miner (Motherlode Mine)|miner]] mining an ore vein in the Motherlode Mine.]]
[[Ore vein|Ore veins]] can be mined for [[pay-dirt]], yielding 60 Mining [[experience]] each. On the lower level, veins have a 33% chance of depleting each time an ore is mined,{{CiteForum|author=Mod Ash|name=uppervslower|url=http://services.runescape.com/m=forum/forums.ws?380,381,366,65884485,goto,2#18|archiveurl=https://archive.is/JgXHN#70%|title=Shift-Click Drop & QoL|forum=Old School Announcements|postdate=23-Feb-2017 11:09:04|archivedate=28 August 2021}} giving an expected 3 pay-dirt per vein mined.

The veins also have a chance to give [[uncut gem]]s. The [[amulet of glory]]'s mining effect can be used to increase the chance of receiving a gem. When a gem is mined, no experience is given for the gem, just the pay-dirt. This means that for each gem mined, you will get 60 less experience per inventory, thus wearing this amulet is not recommended when mining for experience or [[golden nugget]]s. You can optionally trade 100 golden nuggets with [[Prospector Percy]] for a [[gem bag]] to negate this effect.

[[Clue geode]]s cannot be obtained in the Motherlode Mine.

With 72 Mining, players can pay Prospector Percy a one-time fee of 100 [[golden nugget]]s to be granted permission to the upper level of the mine, which is accessible via the ladder near the [[bank chest]]. The upper level contains 64 additional ore veins that are closer to one another compared to the lower level. The upper level veins disappear when a pay-dirt is mined after more than 20 seconds after the first is mined, rather than having a probability of becoming depleted per ore mined.{{CiteForum|author=Mod Ash|url=http://services.runescape.com/m=forum/forums.ws?380,381,369,65889334,goto,5#44|title=General QoL!|archiveurl=https://archive.is/b8ZtL#40%|forum=Old School Announcements|postdate=09-Mar-2017 13:06:57|archivedate=28 August 2021}}
{{Skilling success chart|label=Pay-dirt mining chance|showbefore=no
|label1=Pay-dirt|low1=60|high1=105|req1=30|color1=brown|image1=Pay-dirt.png
}}
{{Clear|left}}

===Cleaning===
{{:Pay-dirt}}

====Deposits====
[[File:Motherlode Mine HUD.png|frame|The HUD displaying the amount of pay-dirt in the sack.]]
The hopper does not allow pay-dirt to be be deposited into the hopper once the sack contains at least 81 items, or 162 if the sack upgrade has been purchased from [[Prospector Percy]] for 200 [[golden nugget]]s. The hopper also does not allow two stacks of pay-dirt from the same player in the waterway at once. Once the sack has a minimum of 81 (or 162) items, a chatbox message states: "''Some ore is ready to be collected from the sack. It's getting full.''" At this point, the hopper will not accept deposits until the sack is searched and there are fewer than 81 (or 162) items in the sack.

The hopper will always accept an entire inventory of pay-dirt if there is no pay-dirt in the waterway from the player and the sack has not yet reached at least 81 (or 162) items. Thus, an "extra" 27 pay-dirt can be deposited into the hopper before it is cleaned by first totaling deposits to one less than the maximum (80, or 161 with the sack upgrade). Overall it is recommended to carry a hammer and a [[gem bag]] to maximise both profit and the number of deposits. Below are examples of optimal orders of deposits:

*Regular sack: 24 + 28 + 28 + 28 = '''108 pay-dirt''', or  27 + 27 + 26 + 28 = '''108 pay-dirt'''.
*Upgraded sack: 21 + 28 + 28 + 28 + 28 + 28 + 28 = '''189 pay-dirt''', or 27 + 27 + 27 + 27 + 27 + 26 + 28= '''189 pay-dirt'''.

The most consistent method to avoid wasting time dropping anything is to have your hammer and either your gem bag or stack of golden nuggets in your inventory, although this allows you to only pick up 26 items at a time. The gem bag will also negate the need to drop or bank gems. With this method, you can deposit up to 104 pay-dirt, or up to 182 with sack upgrade.

===Fixing broken struts===
[[File:Motherlode Mine - Fixing the water wheel.png|thumb|A player using a hammer to fix a waterwheel.]]
Occasionally, the struts on the water wheels will break. This event is visible to everyone and is not player-specific. If both of them are broken, the water flow will stop, and any pay-dirt that was making its way to the sack will be frozen in place until the water flow is restored.

The struts can be fixed using a [[hammer]] and grants [[Smithing]] [[experience]] equal to 1.5 times the player's Smithing level. Hammers can be found in the crates surrounding the machine. You can also hop to another world where the strut is already intact, as the result will be the same.

The chance to repair a strut is dependent on Smithing level, with a base chance of 12% to repair each tick at level 1, up to a 27% chance each tick at level 99.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1510918071019610115|date=date=5 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.is/FFvB6|archivedate=5 April 2022|quote=Yes, it's based on Smithing. 12% at level 1, 27% at level 99 for each roll.}}

===Rockfalls===
Rocks will occasionally fall in certain areas of the mine, blocking players' ways through the mine. They can be mined away for 10 experience. [[Runite Minor]] and the other [[Miner (Motherlode Mine)|miner]]s may remove these rockfalls, though they tend to be busy mining for pay-dirt. [[Box trap]]s and other traps placed on the ground may be laid to temporarily prevent rockfalls from blocking a path, until the box trap collapses.

Falling rocks will damage any unlucky players who happen to be standing under them for a few (1-4) [[Hitpoints]].

===Shortcut===
There is a [[shortcut]] by the bank chest, connecting the east side of the mine to the centre. The shortcut requires 54 Agility and completion of the [[medium Falador Diary]] to use.

===Upper level===
At a cost of 100 [[golden nugget]]s, players with 72 Mining can unlock the upper level by trading with [[Prospector Percy]]. Unlocking this early on is strongly recommended, especially for players that lack the 54 Agility required for the shortcut. The upper level is closer to the bank and hopper, and the ore veins mechanics are time-based and shareable with others, in contrast to the veins at the lower levels that have a 33% chance of depleting whenever a pay-dirt is mined.

Due to the ore vein timer starting after the first ore is mined, mining veins on low population worlds that are not in use by other players will provide more consistent timings and will be more low effort.

==Rewards==
[[Golden nugget]]s can be obtained by searching the sack after cleaning the [[pay-dirt]], with 2.74% chance per pay-dirt, independent of [[Mining]] levels.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/608325164334465024|date=8 June 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.is/6MxfN|archivedate=29 May 2020|quote=Sorry, I just rechecked. It's actually a flat rate of 2.74% at all levels for a paydirt to become a gold nugget.}} Each golden nugget in the sack is collected at once. Golden nuggets are used as currency at [[Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop]] to trade for a variety of rewards.
{{:Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop}}
Furthermore, players can talk to Prospector Percy to gain access to the upper level (with 72 Mining) or upgrade the pay-dirt sack for respectively 100 and 200 golden nuggets.

The experience and profit rates of Motherlode Mine can vary based on level, the tier of pickaxe used, the amount of other players and whether the upper floor is used; it does not scale linearly. With rough estimates, players with 30 Mining can expect approximately 20,000 experience and {{coins|2,000}} profit per hour, with 61 Mining approximately 30,000 experience and {{coins|20,000}} profit per hour, and with 99 Mining approximately 52,000 experience and {{coins|300,000}} profit per hour.

Compared to other methods of training Mining, Motherlode Mine requires relatively low effort for moderate experience and profit, and it is one of the least attention-requiring methods. In contrast, mining [[iron ore]] or [[granite]] can provide significantly higher experience rates, at the cost of being more click-intensive and offering no profit, as those items are dropped when mining efficiently.

==Trivia==
[[File:Rockfall partyhat.png|thumb|Some falling rocks wearing party hats during Christmas.]]
*The rockfalls share the same model as the [[pet rock]] when they fall from the ceiling. As a result, the falling rocks wear party hats during Christmas.
*An interesting note about the upper level is that when a player climbs up the ladder, the player character does not actually move up a plane in the game, rather the terrain on the upper level is simply raised up from the ground on the plane the player character is standing on, so the player will be able to see other players and NPCs on both levels (just like the mechanics in [[Castle Wars]]).
*There are several popular culture and community references within the Motherlode Mine:
**On the western side of the mine, there is an [[NPC]] named [[Runite Minor]], named after the designer of the Motherlode Mine and winner of the 2014 Player Designed Content.
**In the middle of Prospector Percy's machine, there is a baby mole with the examine text "''Mooooooooooooole''", a reference to a scene from the film ''{{WP|Austin Powers in Goldmember}}''.
**Prospector Percy's appearance and examine text are references to the character Stinky Pete from ''{{WP|Toy Story 2}}''.
**The miner in the northeastern corner of the mine has examine text that reads "''Secretly, he'd like to rescue princesses and eat mushrooms''", a reference to the {{WP|Mario (franchise)|''Mario'' video game franchise}} as the miners share a similar appearance to its titular character.
**A miner in the southwestern corner reveals that "he became a miner after his {{WP|agoraphobia}} stopped him doing Sailing", a reference to the supposed [[Sailing]] skill.
**A miner along the east wall's examine text reads "He could have been a great ballet dancer if they'd let him try." This is a reference to the film ''{{WP|Billy Elliot}}'', about a father's expectations for his son to be a miner, and not to follow his dreams of being a dancer.
**A miner on the eastern side has the examine text “professional miners don’t actually whistle while they work” which is a reference to Disney’s Snow White and the Seven Dwarves
*The machine [[Prospector Percy]] built to wash the pay-dirt is a cheap knockoff of the machine used in the [[Lovakengj]] [[blast mine]]. According to the [[operator]]s, the design is a secret, and those who try to copy it would "never get it quite right" and "their machine would break down all the time", referencing the fact that the struts on the water wheel often break.
